head.title: Pedestrian Badly Hurt By Police Van

hedline.hl1: Pedestrian Badly Hurt By Police Van

abstract.p: Glorious Mack, New York City traffic agent driving police van against traffic, strikes and critically injures pedestrian Hollie Bailey on 11th Avenue and 43rd Street in Manhattan (S)

block.p: A city traffic agent driving a police van against traffic struck and critically injured a pedestrian on 11th Avenue and 43rd Street in Manhattan yesterday, the police said.

The agent, Glorious Mack, 48, was driving south in a northbound lane with her lights flashing when she struck the man, Hollie Bailey, 38, about 4:20 p.m., said Officer Cheryl Cox, a police spokeswoman. A traffic agent is a police department employee who issues parking tickets and other summonses.

The agent, Glorious Mack, 48, was driving south in a northbound lane with her lights flashing when she struck the man, Hollie Bailey, 38, about 4:20 p.m., said Officer Cheryl Cox, a police spokeswoman. A traffic agent is a police department employee who issues parking tickets and other summonses.
It was not clear why Ms. Mack was driving in the wrong lane and had her emergency lights on or whether Mr. Bailey was crossing the street legally, Officer Cox said.
Mr. Bailey was in critical but stable condition at St. Vincents Hospital and Medical Center last night.
